item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition launches May 28
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Updated distribution schedule also adjusted.

Following a delay from its previously planned March 26 release date, Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will now launch on May 28 for $54.99 / 7,590 yen, developer Dragami Games announced. Users who own the Switch version will be able to upgrade via an “Upgrade Pack” for $9.99 / 1,100 yen.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 12, 2024, followed by PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on December 2, 2024. Total sales surpassed 300,000 units on August 12, 2025.

Here are the latest details:

■ Notice and Apology Regarding the Release Delay of Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition

The title was originally scheduled for release on March 26, 2026. However, in addition to ongoing development for the Nintendo Switch 2 version, we have determined that significant revisions are also required for the currently available Nintendo Switch version. As a result, we have made the difficult decision to postpone the release to May 28, 2026.

Furthermore, the free additional costume “Burlesque Bunny,” which was planned for distribution on the same day as the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition release, will also have its release timing adjusted accordingly.

We sincerely apologize to all fans who have been looking forward to the release of the game and its updates.

■ Upcoming Update Schedule, Including “Burlesque Bunny”

The winning costumes from the Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Costume Design Contest, held from September 2 to October 27 last year, were originally planned for sequential release following the implementation of “Burlesque Bunny.”

However, due to the postponement of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, we will move forward with the release of later scheduled updates. This decision reflects our desire to deliver new content to our fans as early as possible.

The next update will introduce the second winning costume, “Die Hard Patriot.”

Featuring a striking bikini and hot pants inspired by the American flag, this bold and distinctive design brings a powerful visual impact to Juliet’s wardrobe.

—“Die Hard Patriot” Design Illustration

—“Die Hard Patriot” 3D Model

This costume is scheduled for release in early March 2026 for the following platforms:

PlayStation / Xbox / PC

Regarding the Nintendo Switch version, development resources are currently focused on the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. Therefore, we regret to inform you that the winning costumes will be implemented after the release of Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. We appreciate your understanding.

Additionally, the upcoming winning costumes “Succubus Juliet” and “Kogal” are also in active development.

We are pleased to share new images showing the current progress.

—“Succubus Juliet” 3D Model

—“Kogal” 3D Model

Further details, including release dates for upcoming updates, will be announced on the official Dragami Games X account (@Dragami_Games) as soon as they are finalized. Please stay tuned for future updates.

item.title: The Fox’s Way Home – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Due out on February 26.

BeXide has announced The Fox’s Way Home – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. It will launch on February 26. Users who own the Switch version can upgrade via an “Upgrade Pack” for $2.99.

The Fox’s Way Home first launched for PC via Steam on October 10, 2024, followed by Switch on January 9, 2025.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Edition offers the following improvements over the Switch version:

  • Frame Rate – Improved frame rates provide smoother gameplay.
  • Higher Resolution – High-resolution support provides even sharper graphics.
  • Mouse Control – You can now switch the right Joy-Con 2 to mouse mode for mouse-based controls.

Here is an overview of the game, via BeXide:

About

Dancing fox shrine maiden! A slightly sexy Apparition Find game

The game is very simple! First, watch the dance performed by the Fox Shrine Maiden carefully and memorize it well. Be sure not to get distracted by her sexy allure and miss any part of the dance.

How to Play

To return to your original world, you must witness all the rituals performed by the Fox Shrine Maiden. Sometimes, apparitions called “mononoke” will try to deceive you by taking on a form very similar to the Fox Shrine Maiden and tempt you.

Stay strong, watch the rituals carefully, and don’t get enchanted by the seductive fox dance, so you can spot the “mononoke”!

“One! If you believe it is my real self, call upon my name!”

“Two! If you think it to be an impostor, see through the deception at once!”

“Know that if you err in either, the ritual fails immediately!”

If you find a difference from the initial dance, press the “Fake.” If you don’t find anything suspicious, watch the dance untill the end or press the “Real.” Light all eight lanterns to return to the world you came from!

Apparition Encyclopedia

The various forms of the “mononoke” you have exposed can be recorded in an encyclopedia. Repeat the rituals and create your very own captivating “Apparition Encyclopedia”!
